channel.title: Members on YiLab
channel.description: Recent content in Members on YiLab

item.title: Prof. Keke Yi
item.description: I’m a group leader of soil-plant interaction at the Institute of Agricultural Resources and Regional Planning (IARRP) from the Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences (CAAS). My group is working with the molecular mechanism of Pi uptake and homeostasis in plants.

item.title: Dr. Wenyuan Ruan
item.description: Research Interests: Crop Science Mineral nutrition associated shoot architecture and crop yields Mechanisms of mineral nutrition sensing, uptake, translocation, and utilization Crosstalk of mineral nutrition signaling and homeostasis Education: 2011-2014, PhD in Biochemistry and molecular biology, Zhejiang University 2008-2011, MS in Plant Science, Jilin University 2004-2008, BS in Biological Engineering, Hebei University of Science and Technology Contact: Email: ORCID:

item.title: Dr. Lei Xu
item.description: Research Interests: Regulation mechanisms of root meristem activety in rice Uptake and transport of phosphate Education: PhD in Biology, Zhejiang University Contact: Email: xuleisy@zju.edu.cn ORCID:

item.description: Research Interests: Evo-Devo Molecular Genetics and Evolution Bioinformatics Multi-omics analysis Education: PhD in Biology, Zhejiang University Contact: Email: ORCID:

item.title: Dr. Long Wang
item.description: Phosphorus is an essential plant nutrient, which participates in all metabolic processes in plants. Due to the easy fixation by soil, nearly 70% of global arable land suffers from Pi deficiency. Thus, farmers have to apply more phosphate fertilizer to guarantee the plant growth and crop yield, which in turn also causes severe eutrophication.

item.title: Dr. Xianqing Jia
item.description: Xianqing finished his PhD study at Nanjing University and joined our lab in June 2020. He has board interest in evolution of genomic features accompanied by morphologic changes in plants. Research Interests: Evo-Devo Plant-Microbe interaction Molecular Genetics and Evolution Bioinformatics and Multi-omics analysis Education: 2017.
